RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Precast materials have been inspected and fit for purpose and free of defects
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed Receival and Inspection Checklist
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Precast Reinforced Concrete Pipes shall comply with requirements of AS 4058
○ Pits deeper than 1.00m to be fitted with step irons as shown on the drawings. Step irons are compliant with AS4680 with a minimum average coating thickness equivalent to 600 g/m2.
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document review & Site inspection
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Receival & Inspection Checklist, Manufacturer certificate or accreditation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Nominated material shall be free from perishable matter and conform with the requirements below:
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Test Reports from supplier
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Nominated material shall be free from perishable matter and conform with the requirements below:
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Test Reports from supplier
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Cementituous grouts shall be minimum Type C class dual shinkage compensating, with a minimum 28 day compressive strength of 40 Mpa
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Test Reports from supplier
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: An excavation permit must be issued prior to any excavation commencing.
○ Plant and equipment shall be appropriate for the task.
○ Excavation operations shall not disturb areas outside the limit of excavation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The position of all drainage lines are to be confirmed with the superintendent
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Horizontal clearance ( between the walls of trench to the side of pipe shall be 300mm – 600mm for pipes, and 0.5 to 1 times the overall height of the culvert for box culverts.
○ Trench walls to be vertical where practical
○ > 100mm below underside of pipe (for pipe width < 1500 mm)
○ > 200mm below underside of pipe (for pipe width > 1500 mm)
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Compacted to refusal using mechanical plant.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bedding material shall be compactied to no less than the below thickness:
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pipes & pits placed as shown on the drawings. No laying to occur until bedding lines and levels and compaction requirements have been satisfied

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Consecutive sections of box culverts shall be firmly butted together. The top sections shall be matched to the bottom sections and shall not be lapped over adjoining bottom sections. The contact areas between the top and bottom sections shall be mortared. Multi-row box culverts shall be laid with the sections in each row in contact with the sections in the adjacent rows.
2.8 - Place & compact backfill material over pipes
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Backfill under paved area: fill trench with selected back fill material to subgrade level
– Backfill under area not paved: Back fill trench with selected back fill to a level 0.3 m above the top of pipe or culvert, and ordinary back fill above that level
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: No repairs shall be undertaken without the superintendents approval of the repair materials and procedures
○ All repair procedures undertaken in accordance with Cl 701.25
3.1 - Compaction and moisture content of backfill & bedding material
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Backfill material shall be compactied to a mean density ratio of 92% using standard compactive effort.
○ Bedding material shall be compacted using a compaction plated to refusal.
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.

name: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All personnel on site have been inducted to the Ballarto Rd & Lyrebird Dr Project site
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Site induction signed.
1.2 - Safety measures are in place, Safe Work Mathod Statement (SWMS) undertaken
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, CEMP, TMP & SWMS
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Health and Safety Co-Ordination Plan
RESPONSIBILITY: Site Engineer, Site Foreman & Superintendent
1.3 - Check that current revision drawings are being used
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Issued For Construction (IFC) and latest available revision used
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Project Drawings / Drawing Register
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Latest Revision Drawings
1.4 - Confirm understanding of current CEMP and CHMP related to the work area and that all prescribed environmental controls are in place
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All environmental measures to be implemented as per current EMP and local authorities. Sediment control measures to be installed and protected vegetation to be clearly identified
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: IFC Drawings, CEMP, CHMP
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document review & Site inspection
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Current Excavation Permit signed and specific for the area where works will be executed.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Prior to commencing excavation in any area and during excavation work, the Superintendent and FH shall inspect each type of material encountered and subject to verification by appropriate laboratory testing and agree on the category of the material.
○ Type B material shall be totally free of organic content, topsoil, deleterious and/or perishable matter such as bricks, concrete, glass, plastic, timber, steel or steel by-products.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl. 204.06(c), Cl.204.04(c)
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Test Results, Material Category agreed with Superintendent

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Survey activities undertaken to ensure and validate that all works meet level and location requirements. The establishment and integrity of the survey network shall be verified before commencing any survey and setout activity. IFC and latest available revision used
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Survey records & pegs on the ground
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: No fill is to be placed on the prepared areas until the the area has been reviewed by the Superintendent
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Area reviewed by Superintendent, Signed ITP
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Placement surface textured to ensure layers keyed into each other.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Layers placed and spread in uniform compacted layers not thicker than 200mm.

○ A procedure shall be established to verify that compacted layers do not exceed the specified maximum thickness. Verification records must provide evidence of measurements taken at least every three layers in consistent locations across the filled areas, and must be retained with the lot records.
FREQUENCY: Each Lot (one day's production or 5,000m2, whichever is lesser)
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Areas upon which fills are to be constructed, all layers of fill, and material within 150 mm of the cut floor level in cuts, shall be test rolled in accordance with Section 173.
○ Superintendent to be present during all test rolling.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl. 204.12, Cl.173.03
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Proof Roll Form completed & signed.
FREQUENCY: Prior to construction of subgrade layer

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The top of the Type B material, Cut Floor Level and subgrade surfaces shall be prepared to level and shape within the tolerances specified in Clause 204.03(g) to produce a smooth, hard, tightly bound surface, free from depressions capable of holding water).
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl. 204.15, Cl. 204.03(g)
FREQUENCY: Prior to construction of subgrade layer

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Surface is smooth, hard, tightly bound and free from depressions which are capable of holding water. Surface is not to be more than 15mm or less than 30mm from what is specificed in IFC drawings
FREQUENCY: Initially test every lot until three consecutive achieve passing results. If achieved, minimum frequency of testing from Table 204.142 of VicRoads must be agreed with Superintendent.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Type B Material placed more than 400 mm below top of Type B Material should be compacted to 97% of MDD. Type B Material placed within 400 mm of top of Type B Material should be compacted to 99% MDD.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Compaction Test Records
FREQUENCY: Test every lot (one day's production or 10,000m2, whichever is lesser) until 3 consecutive lots have achieved specified requirements.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Maximum particle size should be 150mm when soil is within 400mm of the top of Type B soil, and 400 mm at depths greater than 400 mm below the top of Type B material.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl. 204.04(c), Cl.204.14(a)
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Maximum Particle Size Test Records
FREQUENCY: The initial lot (one day's production or 10,000m2, whichever is lesser). Reduced testing frecuency (every 8 lots) for future lots shall be agreed with the Superintendent
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: CBR: ≥ 2%, Swell: < 2.5% swells greater than or equal to 2.5% shall be classified as expansive and approved by the Superintendent).
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: CBR/Swell Test Records

FREQUENCY: 1 Test per 2 lots (each lot is one day's production or 10,000m2, whichever is lesser) until 3 consecutive lots have achieved specified requirements. Reduced testing frecuency (1 test per every 4 lots) for future lots shall be agreed with the Superintendent
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that soil post-compaction is not classified as silt
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl. 204.14 Table 204.141
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: PI Test Records
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Crushed rock mixes proposed for use on specified works shall be registered in accordance with VicRoads Code of Practice for Registration of Crushed Rock Mix Designs as listed in Section 175.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Mix Design VicRoads Approval
FREQUENCY: Check prior to placing material
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Material should be spread to minimize number of jointsTransverse joints shall be offset from one layer to next by not less than 2 metres
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl.304.07 (a), Cl.304.07 (c)
FREQUENCY: Check prior to placing material

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Material should be spread to minimize number of jointsLongitudinal joints offset from one layer to next by not less than 150mmLongitudinal joints to be located within 300mm from planned traffic lane lines or within 300 mm of the centre of a traffic lane.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl.304.07 (a), Cl.304.07 (d), Cl.304.07 (e)
FREQUENCY: Check prior to placing material
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: A single lot shall be considered a single layer of 4000m2 or one days production in a single layer, whichever is lesser.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl.304.08 (b)(ii) Table 304.111
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pavement lots should be subject to proof roll as outlined in VicRoads Section 173, under supervision of Superintendent
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl.304.08(b)(iv), Cl. 173
3.1 - Determine Testing Scale & Initial testing frequency
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Table 204.161 from VicRoads Standard nominates the level of testing required for acceptance of Surface Level Measurement.

○ Scale A - Initially test every lot until 3 consecutive lots of like material and/or work have achieved the standards specified in Clauses 304.08. and 304.10. If no failures, Reduced Frequency applies as specified in Table 304.111.
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document Review/ Site Inspection
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Characteristic Value of Density Ratio for Subbase:- > 97.0% (Scale B) 1 per every lot
○ Minimum number of measurements per lot: 40 For Upper
○ Upper Subbase: Mean + 6mm to - 12mm with a maximum Standard Deviation of 8mm
○ Lower Subbase: Mean +8mm to -16mm with a maximum Standard Deviation of 10mm.
○ Base: Mean ± 8mm with a maximum Standard Deviation of 8mm.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Table 304.061, Table 304.062
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.

– using the correct and complete set of drawings
– all drawings are the latest revision
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Material proposed for import for 3% Class 3 CTCR (20mm) meets the requirements of VR Section 812 or 820. Obtain material compliance data from the supplier and submit to VRs for approval
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Cl 812.04, Section 820.04 to 820.09, RC 500.02
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Mix Design VicRoads Approval - Quarry Dockets
1.3 - Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: QMP, TMP, SWMS & ITP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Contractor shall supply all materials required to construct the cementitious treated pavement subbase. The supply of Cementitious Treated Crushed Rock or Cementitious Treated Crushed Concrete shall comply with the requirements of Section 815.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The moisture content of the material at the time of spreading and compaction, expressed as a percentage by mass, shall be within plus 0.5% and minus 1.0 % from the Modified optimum moisture content.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The layout of joints shall conform to the following requirements unless otherwise approved by the Superintendent:
(a) material shall be spread in such a manner as to minimise the number of joints;
(b) in any layer, transverse joints in adjoining paver runs shall be offset by not less than 2 m;
(c) transverse joints shall be offset from one layer to the next by not less than 2 m;
(d) longitudinal joints shall be offset from one layer to the next by not less than 150 mm;
(e) longitudinal joints shall be located within 300 mm of the planned position of traffic lane lines or within 300 mm of the centre of a traffic lane.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pavement subbase shall be finished to a smooth and uniform surface and shall, after compaction, conform within the following limits to the levels, lines, grades, thicknesses and cross sections as specified or shown on the drawings.
– The width of pavement measured on each side of the centreline or design line shall not deviate by more than 50 mm from the designed offset when measured at a right angle.
(b) Surface Level of Subgrade and Pavement

– The surface level of the subgrade and pavement courses shall be measured in accordance with the requirements of Section 173 and every test lot shall meet requirements as specified in Clause 306.031 and 306.032
○ Surface level tolerances: Scale B - Range x = +6, -12mm:
○ Scale of Surface level measurement: Scale B - Minimum 40 points per Lot
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: String Report / Visiual and ITP Signoff

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The cementitious treated subbase material shall be placed, trimmed to level and fully compacted within the maximum allowable working time specified in Table 306.091 depending on the binder type and the time of year the subbase is being placed. Except for the purpose of curing, no water shall be added to the cementitious treated material.
○ The work represented by the lot will be accepted as far as compaction is concerned if the mean density ratio for the lot is not less than 96.0%.

○ If the mean of the individual density ratio test values for the lot is less than 96.0%, but greater than or equal to 92% the work represented by the lot may be accepted but the method of rectification and/or redesign of the pavement shall be approved by the Superintendent.
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Compaction test and Visual
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off; Test reports
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pavement Design Modulus of 500 MPa or where no Pavement Design Modulus is Specified
○ The surface of each compacted layer shall be kept moist for a period of seven days unless covered at an earlier stage with the succeeding layer or with an approved curing membrane.
○ Construction or other traffic shall not use a compacted layer within 24 hours of placement without the approval of the Superintendent.
○ The subbase shall be kept in good order and condition and free from contamination.
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Compaction test and Visual
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off;

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Test rolling may be carried out in accordance with the requirements of Section 173 on the cementitious treated pavement subbase layer within the maximum allowable working time for the relevant binder and time of year as specified in Table 306.091.
○ Proof rolls to be conducted in accordance with Section 173 of the VicRoads Standard Specification. Proof roll will need to withstand test rolling without visible deformation or springing
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off; Test reports
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where material is measured by other means and for Lump Sum Contracts, the Contractor shall make delivery dockets available for inspection on request.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off; Test reports
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.

INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document review & Site inspection
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Current Excavation Permit signed and specific for the area where works will be executed.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All subsurface drainage pipes shall have a maximum perforation width of 1.5mm and a minimum length of 150mm/m2
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The base of the trench shall be sufficiently compacted and not more than 50mm below the invert level of the pipe to be placed.
○ Perforated Pipe Crown level to be minimum 200mm below subgrade level.
○ Grade of trench to be not flatter than 1 in 250.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl.702.08, VicRoads Spec. Cl.702.09(a)(b)

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where geotextile is to be used as a first stage filter in contact with a trench wall, the trench wall shall be excavated to allow the geotextile to be in close contract with the wall when granular material is placed against the geotextile.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure bedding of thickness between 25-50mm is placed across the bottom of trench and graded to level.
○ Pipes are firmly in place, slotted pipes positioned so openings are in lower half of the pipe

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Filter material shall be moistened and compacted with minimal disturbance to pipes. The method of compaction shall be in accordance with the procedures and reviewed by the Superintendent.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Flushing test shall be witnessed by a representative nominated by the superintendent and shall confirm that the drainage line is free of obstruction
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Signed ITP/ Record of flushing tests

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All subsurface drainage lines constructed shall be inspected, after completion of the flushing test as stated in clause 702.09(h) and prior to placement of asphalt, by an independent testing organisation using closed circuit television (CCTV) to verify that the flow of water is not obstructed by waste construction material left inside and to check for visible signs of defects.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Signed ITP/ Record of flushing tests

name: FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
– using the correct and complete set of drawings
– all drawings are the latest revision
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: QMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: QMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Set out work in accordance with drawings. The superintendent will review and confirm set out. The alignment and survey/level pegs will be indicated to the Contractor on the Site by the Superintendent prior to the commencement of work. No survey/level pegs to be removed by any persons until completion of works.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: If obstructing waterways, culverts or channels, temporary diversion of discharge of drainage and stormwater to be in place.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All bedding material shall conform with the requirements of sections 812 or 820 for crushed rock and crushed concrete respectively.
○ Unless otherwise stated, 20mm Class 3 or 4 bedding shall be used adn compacted to a thickness of not less than 100mm.
○ Bedding shall be trimmed to appropriate levels, moistened as necessary, and be firmly compacted.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bedding shall be moist but shall have no free water on the surface.
○ Concrete shall not be placed when the air temperature measured at the point of placement is >35°C or <5°C.
○ Temperature of concrete, measured immediately prior to placing, shall not be less than 10°C or greater than 32°C.
○ Concrete extrusion machines have minimum cement content of 320kg/m3.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete is to be fed to extrusion machine at a uniform rate. Concrete is to be satisfactorily compacted so that finished surfaces are free from surface pitting larger than 5mm diameter, honey combing or faulty patches
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Edgings: rendered to a thickness not exceeding 3mm and trowel finished.
○ Concrete to have a neat appearance and uniform colour
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Transverse joints constructed at intervals not exceeding 2.5m.
○ Groove cut 20mm deep and > 5mm wide on exposed surfaces, with vertical cut made through the base of the groove (depth >50mm from surface of section).
○ Prevent bonding between surfacing and edging either paint with bitumen or use a strip of bitumen
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Not earlier than 3 days after casting.

○ Topsoil material free from perishable matter, lumps or balls of clay. Topsoil compacted behind the edging to a level of the top of the edging and to a width not less than 300mm unless otherwise specified.
○ Layers shall not exceed 150mm compacted depth

ITP-017 - Sealing Works - Asphalt Laying Works Wearing Course
template name: ITP-017 - Sealing Works - Asphalt Laying Works Wearing Course

name: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure this mix design has been registered and is approved by Superintendent prior to laying mix.
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Correspondence of receipt of mix design
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: VR approval, Completed ITP
RESPONSIBILITY: Site Engineer/ Asphalt Supervisor / Superintendent
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: QMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS & WP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: QMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Surface on which asphalt is to be placed is essentially dry and free from puddles and defects (holes, cracks, unstable material and edge irregularities) and loose materials.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The majority of the surface area to be paved has a temperature greater than or equal to the following:
○ Base & Intermediate Courses: 5°C for conventional binders or
○ Wearing Courses: 10°C for conventional binders or 15°C for PMBs
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Runs to be marked to ensure placement of joints satisfy the following unless otherwise approved by the Client:
○ Transverse Joints Offset from layer to layer by at least 2m
○ Longitudinal Joints Offset from layer to layer by at least
○ 150mm and be within 300mm of the lane line or centre of lane. Wearing course shall be on lane lines.
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Measure and mark out runs by tape measure or survey

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The placement of asphalt on the sub-base or granular base for a new pavement or for an overlay of an existing bituminous surfaced pavement shall not commence until the consent to proceed is obtained from the Client.
RESPONSIBILITY: Site Engineer/ Asphalt Supervisor / Superintendent
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Asphalt is not segregated, binder is not separated or does not contain uncoated particles and the temperature from mixing plant is not more than 175°C.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ability to locate asphalt test results placed in three dimensions i.e. start/end chainage, offset/lane and layer
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Fulton Hogan Quality Plan
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Daily Lot Record
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Thickness of asphalt layer conforms to asphalt thickness on drawings or specifications
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Dips using ruler or dip stick
FREQUENCY: During paving and after final roll
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The finished surface of asphalt wearing course shall be of uniform appearance, free of dragged areas, cracks, open textured patches and roller marks
FREQUENCY: During paving and after final roll
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The edge of the wearing course shall be either flush with or not more than 5 mm above the lip of the channel unless otherwise specified
2.7 - Alignment of layers not placed against concrete edge
FREQUENCY: During paving and at completion of work
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The edge of asphalt layers shall not be more than 50mm inside nor more than 100mm outside, the designed offset from centreline or design line.
○ The rate of change of offset of the edge of layer shall not be greater than 25mm in 10m
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: For layers <50mm, if characteristic density ratio is:
○ 91.0% to 93.9% Lot may be accepted at reduced rate
– For layers ≥50mm, if characteristic thickness is:
○ 91.0% to 95.9% Lot may be accepted at reduced rate
RESPONSIBILITY: Site Engineer/ FH Lab Technician
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Individual departures from design not to exceed ±5mm with a standard deviation of no greater than 8mm (Scale A)
